resources.string:
My name is Kassandra Camarillo. I am from San Diego, CA. I am enrolled in the MS program in Computer Science at PACE University. I completed a coding bootcamp in 2023 where I discovered a love for coding which has led me to pursue the MS program at PACE University and ultimately begin a career in computer science.

 I currently work at a psychiatric hospital in San Diego. In 2020, I completed an AmeriCorps fellowship where I worked in a Safe Parking Program which offers support to unsheltered San Diegans living out of their vehicles. After completing the AmeriCorps fellowship, I worked at a homeless shleter in downtown San Diego. My goal is to use my computer programming skills to help undeserved communities, particularly individuals experiencing homelessness.
In my free time I enjoy hiking, running, cycling, surfing, camping, pretty much anything that gets me outdoors. I also like reading and painting.
